channel.title: Linux on devopstales
channel.description: Recent content in Linux on devopstales

item.title: Configure squid transparent proxy on pfsense
item.description: In this post I will show you how you can install squid proxy on pfsense and configure as a transparent proxy.

item.title: Ubuntu 22.04 - Microsoft Active Directory Group Policy
item.description: In this Post I will show you the new Active Directory Group Policy integration in Ubuntu 22.04.

item.title: Running and Building ARM Docker Containers on x86
item.description: I this post I will show you how you can run AMD Docker Containers on x86 environment adn build multi CPU architecture images.

item.title: How to create your own Homebrew repo?
item.description: I this post I will show you in a Step-by-Step guide how cou can create your own Homebrew repository on GitHub.

item.title: Using the NetworkManager’s DNSMasq plugin
item.description: Imagine you want to test something in a demo setup with 5 machines. You create the necessary VMs in your local environment – but you cannot address them properly by name. With 5 machines you also need to write down the appropriate IP addresses – that’s hardly practical.

item.title: pgBackRest Backup to S3
item.description: In this article I will show you how to use pgBackRest to backup PostgreSQL servers to S3 buckets.

item.title: pgBackRest Backup server
item.description: In this article I will show you how to use pgBackRest in a dedicated backup server to backup remote PostgreSQL servers.

item.title: PostgreSQL backup with pgBackRest
item.description: In this article I will show you how to use pgBackRest as a backup program for PostgreSQL.

item.title: Install Foreman PXE boot
item.description: Foreman is a complete lifecycle management tool for physical and virtual servers. We give system administrators the power to easily automate repetitive tasks, quickly deploy applications, and proactively manage servers, on-premise or in the cloud.

item.title: Install mattermost for Gitlab
item.description: Mattermost is an open source on premise alternative of Slack.
